title: Restoring Common Sense to Federal Procurement

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs a comprehensive reform of the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to simplify and streamline federal government procurement, removing unnecessary rules to make buying goods and services more efficient and less costly. It requires agencies to align their supplemental procurement rules with the new streamlined FAR and includes provisions for automatic expiration of nonessential regulations to keep procurement flexible and agile.
potential_concerns: Streamlining procurement regulations may decrease oversight and increase risk of fraud or waste in federal contracts.
Removing longstanding FAR provisions could create inconsistencies or confusion during the transition period across agencies.
The automatic sunset of regulations might disrupt ongoing contracts or procurement practices if renewals are not managed carefully.
Efforts to expand the national and defense industrial bases could disadvantage smaller or specialized suppliers not fitting streamlined criteria.
Implementation deadlines are aggressive and may strain agency resources, causing delays or superficial compliance.
